channel.title: Configure
channel.description:
[s]Well, I was having fun with my new Feisty Fawn. Anyways, I normally just download everything to my desktop. Well, when I tried to move something from my desktop to anywhere inside my filesystem, I noticed it wouldn't let me. So I went to check the permissions on the HDD.
Everything that's suppose to say the owner/group/etc says unknown afterwards. Except Access says Read-only and when I try to change it to Read and write it says: My External also says the exact same things.[/s]
Edit: I only install Feisty Fawn a couple days ago, so when I went to ./configure in Terminal before it said: [code]bash: ./configure: No Such file or directory.[/code]

item.title: Configure
item.dc:creator: @Painless Painless
item.description:
@Painless wrote:

Well, I’ve tried with a couple of things. But I’m currently trying to build Songbird.
It’s probably something simple and makes me look like an idiot.

Read full topic

item.title: Configure
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

What are you trying to build?

Read full topic

item.title: Configure
item.dc:creator: @Painless Painless
item.description:
@Painless wrote:

Nope, I wasn’t. It wasn’t letting me move it anywhere. But I restarted the computer a while ago and it started working again.

But I still can’t get ./configure to work.

Read full topic

item.title: Configure
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Are you trying to move the files into the root directory (/)? o.O

You should only move files within your user directory, ie., ‘~’ (/home/user).

Read full topic

item.title: Configure
item.dc:creator: @Painless Painless
item.description:
@Painless wrote:

[s]Well, I was having fun with my new Feisty Fawn. Anyways, I normally just download everything to my desktop. Well, when I tried to move something from my desktop to anywhere inside my filesystem, I noticed it wouldn’t let me. So I went to check the permissions on the HDD.

Everything that’s suppose to say the owner/group/etc says unknown afterwards. Except Access says Read-only and when I try to change it to Read and write it says:
My External also says the exact same things.[/s]

Edit: I only install Feisty Fawn a couple days ago, so when I went to ./configure in Terminal before it said:

bash:  ./configure: No Such file or directory.
